results.name: wordpress-namespace/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-75cc55cbbd-ljp8d Pod/mysql-75cc55cbbd-bmqrn], expected 2

results.details:
Error: The service lacks ready endpoints; the expected 2 pods are not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs [pod-name]`.
3. Verify readiness probes in pod specs.
4. Ensure pods are running and healthy.
5. Restart pods if necessary.

results.name: wordpress-namespace/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-6657f498b7-w7npv Pod/wordpress-6657f498b7-tjdqt Pod/wordpress-6657f498b7-ctvht Pod/wordpress-6657f498b7-m2t9p], expected 4

results.details:
Error: The service lacks ready endpoints; 4 pods are expected but not all are ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect logs using `kubectl logs [pod-name]`.
3. Verify readiness probes in pod spec.
4. Ensure network policies allow traffic.
5. Restart pods if needed.

results.name: wordpress-namespace/wordpress-6657f498b7-w7npv

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.

results.name: wordpress-namespace/mysql-75cc55cbbd-bmqrn

error.Text: Liveness probe failed: dial tcp 10.244.1.9:3306: connect: connection refused

results.details:
Error: The Kubernetes liveness probe failed because it couldn't connect to the service at IP 10.244.1.9 on port 3306.

Solution: 
1. Verify the service is running on the correct IP and port.
2. Check network policies/firewalls.
3. Ensure the pod has the correct permissions.
4. Restart the pod to reinitiate the connection.

results.name: wordpress-namespace/mysql-75cc55cbbd-ljp8d

error.Text:
Readiness probe failed: mysqladmin: connect to server at 'localhost' failed
error: 'Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (2)'
Check that mysqld is running and that the socket: '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' exists!

results.details:
Error: The Kubernetes readiness probe failed because it can't connect to the MySQL server via the specified socket.

Solution: 
1. Ensure MySQL is running: `systemctl status mysql`.
2. Verify the socket file exists: `ls /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock`.
3. Restart MySQL: `systemctl restart mysql`.
